message.content:
cs.CG, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses the optimality of eigenfunctions of the Laplace-Beltrami operator in representing smooth functions on surfaces, which is a topic related to computational geometry (cs.CG). The paper also mentions applications in shape and data analysis, which are relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG). The use of the Courant-Fischer min-max principle and numerical algorithms suggest a focus on numerical analysis (cs.NA). Finally, the paper discusses the use of a novel pseudo-metric and the coupling of principal component analysis with the Laplace-Beltrami operator, which are topics related to scientific computing and information theory (cs.SI).
